section.title: RPM YAML configuration
section.para: The contribution of the tgt1 instance to the puppet-dmsat1 RPM is a set of parameters, distributed over different YAML files. Each time the set of parameters is changed, we need to build a new version of the puppet-dmsat1 RPM. This is also true if other platforms, or subzones, are added to the dmsat1 Deployment zone.

The influence of tgt1 to the YAML fileset of dmsat1 is depicted below.
&t1p; cd /root/puppet-dmsat1/puppet-dmsat1/var/lib/hiera &t1p; ./depzone_platform_instance.sh -d dmsat1 -h tgt1.core.dmsat1.org -i tgt1 -p proxy depzones/dmsat1/hosts/tgt1.core.dmsat1.org.yaml (node) depzones/dmsat1/platforms/proxy/tgt1.yaml (depzone platform instance) depzones/dmsat1/platforms/proxy.yaml (depzone platform) depzones/dmsat1.yaml (depzone) platforms/proxy/tgt1.yaml (platform instance) platforms/proxy.yaml (platform) base.yaml (base)

The code of the puppet-dmsat1 RPM can be found in . The RPM is built with:
&t1p; cd ~/puppet-dmsat1 &t1p; ./build.sh .. output skipped .. &t1p; proxy --resign /root/proxy/RPMS/noarch/puppet-dmsat1-0.1.1-1.noarch.proxy Enter pass phrase: redhat Pass phrase is good. /root/proxy/RPMS/noarch/puppet-dmsat1-0.1.1-1.noarch.proxy: &t1p; scp /root/proxy/RPMS/noarch/puppet-dmsat1-0.1.1-1.noarch.proxy root@192.168.5.11:/tmp root@192.168.5.11's password: redhat puppet-dmsat1-0.1.1-1.noarch.proxy 100% 8743 8.5KB/s 00:00

para.screen: &sw1p; cd /tmp &sw1p; rhnpush -c example-puppet-structure-6u5-1_0 -u example -p redhat puppet-dmsat1-0.1.1-1.noarch.proxy .. no output is success ..

important.title: How to create tgt1 in another depzone?
important.para:
If one wants to create the tgt1 instance in another Deployment zone, one has to adapt all parameters that start with proxy::server::params:: from . The list of files to inspect can be found with:
&t1p; cd /root/puppet-dmsat1/puppet-dmsat1/var/lib/hiera &t1p; ./depzone_platform_instance.sh -d dmsat1 -h tgt1.core.dmsat1.org -i tgt1 -p proxy depzones/dmsat1/hosts/tgt1.core.dmsat1.org.yaml (node) depzones/dmsat1/platforms/proxy.yaml (depzone platform) depzones/dmsat1.yaml (depzone) base.yaml (base)
Of course, the new RPM package should be named puppet-<depzone>. And the files are named like:
&t1p; cd /root/puppet-<depzone>/puppet-<depzone>/var/lib/hiera &t1p; ./depzone_platform_instance.sh -d <depzone> -h tgt1.core.<depzone>.org -i tgt1 -p proxy depzones/<depzone>/hosts/tgt1.core.<depzone>.org.yaml (node) depzones/<depzone>/platforms/proxy.yaml (depzone platform) depzones/<depzone>.yaml (depzone) base.yaml (base)

section.para: An example set of parameters can be found in , in the documentation path, /usr/share/doc/puppet-baseinfra. Start with reading the README.proxy file.
